numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The first thing that I notice is an ascending trend from the lower states upward.
2. There seems to be a belt in the western states.
3. This belt seems out of place.
4. The graph changes over time.
5. The change in the graph seems to start with the warming of the weather.
6. The warming of the weather seems to start in the lower warmer states.
original_comment:
Up Up and Away!!1
the first i notice is the accending from the lower states upward. 
I do notice that there seems to be a belt in the western states seems out of place. The changing of the graph seems to be starting with the warming of the weather starting in the lower warmer states.

numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I am Ronan.
2. I am a high school junior.
3. I live in NYC.
4. I notice a map.
5. The map shows climate.
6. The map shows leaves.
7. On the map, the amount of leaves increases.
8. After April, the amount of leaves decreases.
9. I wonder whether an elevation can cause leaves to appear early in January.
10. In most states, leaves appear more often in April than in January.
11. I wonder whether a whole area can get leaves before other states.
12. I guess that the climate becomes higher in spring.
13. I guess that the elevation becomes higher in spring.
14. I guess that a state collects leaves in spring.
15. I guess that a state collects sunlight in spring.
16. I guess that the terrain of a state relates to this collection.
original_comment:
I am Ronan and I'm a high school junior in NYC. 

I notice that the climate and leaves happening on the map increase and starts decreasing after April. 

I wonder if an elevation can possibly get leaves early in January, even though April gets more appearances of leaves in most states. I'm also wondering if a whole area gets leaves and as much as it needs before the other states.   

My guess on what's happening here is the climate and elevations get higher and higher in the spring time in order to collect leaves and sunlight for its state and terrain.
